page.title: 07Education in Alsagers Bank
page.content: Three members of the Primary School staff attended the hundred and forty six year old school as children. They remember stricter discipline, Bible readings, and learning poetry. Over the years new classrooms and a nursery block have been added. Nowadays informality marks the relationships between the six class teachers and one hundred and sixty six children. A further thirty nine children attend the nursery in half day sessions. We asked some of the pupils for their view of school - see next page.
